thread.title: Husky Hoopla details: Introductions, basketball and a little dancing
thread.title_full: Husky Hoopla details: Introductions, basketball and a little dancing

author: Percy Allen
title: Husky Hoopla details: Introductions, basketball and a little dancing
text:
As for the show itself, details are murky, but don’t expect a scrimmage or anything like that. There will be player introductions, which is a necessity for the UW men’s team that brought in nine newcomers. 
Players will participate in basketball drills and they’re also expected to perform a dance routine. 
“We (the women’s team) worked with the cheerleaders and plan to have some fun with it,” junior star guard Kelsey Plum said last week. 
And the UW men? 
“I don’t think they practiced for this at all so we’ll see,” she said smiling. 
It’s the only public appearance for the UW teams before their exhibition games. The Husky women host Concordia (Oregon) on Nov. 2 and the UW men play Seattle Pacific University on Nov. 5 at Hec Edmundson Pavilion. 


Percy Allen : 206-464-2278 or pallen@seattletimes.com ; on Twitter: @percyallen . Seattle Times staff reporter Percy Allen provides a running commentary on the Huskies.
